timeline.bodyText: Not listed here is the xpack.notification.email.default_account setting. Should it be?
timeline.author: jbaiera
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -103,72 +113,89 @@ can specify the following email account attributes:
 --
 [[email-account-attributes]]

replies.bodyText: Or rather, this setting is defined in the code near these other email settings, and I do not see it in the immediate file, so if it's documented somewhere more sane, then perfect.
replies.author: jbaiera

replies.bodyText: Not really sure how much of that is explicitly needed/useful in the reference docs, but adding a note here for completeness.

replies.bodyText: Thanks for catching this. I've gone ahead and added the missing elements.

timeline.bodyText: Same question here re: dynamic message_defaults
timeline.author: jbaiera
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -245,31 +281,37 @@ via Slack. You can specify the following Slack account attributes:
 --
 [[slack-account-attributes]]
 
-  `secure_url` (<<secure-settings,Secure>>);;
-  The Incoming Webhook URL to use to post messages to Slack. Required.
-
-  `message_defaults.from`;;
-  The sender name to display in the
-                                    Slack message. Defaults to the watch ID.
-
-  `message_defaults.to`;;
-  The default Slack channels or groups you
-                                             want to send messages to.
-
-  `message_defaults.icon`;;
-  The icon to display in the Slack messages.
-                                             Overrides the incoming webhook's configured
-                                             icon. Accepts a public URL to an image.
-
-  `message_defaults.text`;;
-  The default message content.
-
-  `message_defaults.attachment`;;
-  Default message attachments. Slack message attachments
-                                    enable you to create more richly-formatted messages.
-                                    Specified as an array as defined in the
-                                    https://api.slack.com/docs/attachments[
-                                   Slack attachments documentation].
+`secure_url`::
+(<<secure-settings,Secure>>)
+The Incoming Webhook URL to use to post messages to Slack. Required.
+
+`message_defaults.from`::
+(<<static-cluster-setting,Static>>)
+The sender name to display in the
+Slack message. Defaults to the watch ID.
+
+`message_defaults.to`::
+(<<static-cluster-setting,Static>>)
+The default Slack channels or groups you
+want to send messages to.
+
+`message_defaults.icon`::
+(<<static-cluster-setting,Static>>)
+The icon to display in the Slack messages.
+Overrides the incoming webhook's configured
+icon. Accepts a public URL to an image.
+
+`message_defaults.text`::
+(<<static-cluster-setting,Static>>)
+The default message content.
+
+`message_defaults.attachment`::
+(<<static-cluster-setting,Static>>)

timeline.bodyText: xpack.notification.slack.account.***.message_defaults is listed as dynamic in the code. Is this from setting overridden to be static only?
timeline.author: jbaiera
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -245,31 +281,37 @@ via Slack. You can specify the following Slack account attributes:
 --
 [[slack-account-attributes]]
 
-  `secure_url` (<<secure-settings,Secure>>);;
-  The Incoming Webhook URL to use to post messages to Slack. Required.
-
-  `message_defaults.from`;;
-  The sender name to display in the
-                                    Slack message. Defaults to the watch ID.
-
-  `message_defaults.to`;;
-  The default Slack channels or groups you
-                                             want to send messages to.
-
-  `message_defaults.icon`;;
-  The icon to display in the Slack messages.
-                                             Overrides the incoming webhook's configured
-                                             icon. Accepts a public URL to an image.
-
-  `message_defaults.text`;;
-  The default message content.
-
-  `message_defaults.attachment`;;
-  Default message attachments. Slack message attachments
-                                    enable you to create more richly-formatted messages.
-                                    Specified as an array as defined in the
-                                    https://api.slack.com/docs/attachments[
-                                   Slack attachments documentation].
+`secure_url`::
+(<<secure-settings,Secure>>)
+The Incoming Webhook URL to use to post messages to Slack. Required.
+
+`message_defaults.from`::
+(<<static-cluster-setting,Static>>)

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for catching this. I'm honestly not sure what happened here. My methodology was to set up an account in elasticsearch.yml then try to null it out using the cluster update settings API. I did that in branches... so it's possible I messed up my config before testing these.
In any case, I've retested them and double-checked in the code. Thanks again.
replies.author: jrodewig

timeline.bodyText: Similar to the message_defaults setting, this affix setting seems to be configured as dynamic.
timeline.author: jbaiera
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -286,19 +328,23 @@ issues in Jira. You can specify the following Jira account attributes:
 --
 [[jira-account-attributes]]
 
-  `secure_url` (<<secure-settings,Secure>>);;
-  The URL of the Jira Software server. Required.
+`secure_url`::
+(<<secure-settings,Secure>>)
+The URL of the Jira Software server. Required.
 
-  `secure_user` (<<secure-settings,Secure>>);;
-  The name of the user to connect to the Jira Software server. Required.
+`secure_user`::
+(<<secure-settings,Secure>>)
+The name of the user to connect to the Jira Software server. Required.
 
-  `secure_password` (<<secure-settings,Secure>>);;
-  The password of the user to connect to the Jira Software server. Required.
+`secure_password`::
+(<<secure-settings,Secure>>)
+The password of the user to connect to the Jira Software server. Required.
 
-  `issue_defaults`;;
-  Default fields values for the issue created in Jira. See
-  <<jira-action-attributes>> for more information.
-  Optional.
+`issue_defaults`::
+(<<static-cluster-setting,Static>>)

timeline.bodyText: Should this be marked as dynamic?
timeline.author: jbaiera
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -315,40 +361,48 @@ Specifies account information for sending notifications
 via PagerDuty. You can specify the following PagerDuty account attributes:
 +
 --
-`name`;;
+`name`::
+(<<static-cluster-setting,Static>>)
 A name for the PagerDuty account associated with the API key you
 are using to access PagerDuty. Required.
 
-`secure_service_api_key` (<<secure-settings,Secure>>);;
+`secure_service_api_key`::
+(<<secure-settings,Secure>>)
 The https://developer.pagerduty.com/documentation/rest/authentication[
 PagerDuty API key] to use to access PagerDuty. Required.
 --
 +
-`event_defaults`;;
+`event_defaults`::

replies.bodyText: Or rather, this is a dynamic setting in the code, but the below values are marked as static
replies.author: jbaiera
